subject: Programming
title: Boolean Algebra
description: A fast breakdown of Boolean Algebra for builders.

hook.text: In 1854, George Boole published a system of math with only two values: true and false.

buildup.text: Boolean algebra defines rules for combining true/false values using AND, OR, and NOT.

discovery.text: Eighty years later, Claude Shannon realized Boolean algebra perfectly described electrical circuits.

twist.text: Boole never imagined computers. Shannon saw that switches were physical versions of Boole's logic.

climax.text: Every if-statement, every database query, every search filter runs on Boolean logic.

punchline.text: True-or-false math runs the digital world.

quiz.question: Who connected Boolean algebra to electrical circuits?
